data.title: Equine Affaire nearby!
data.text: Great place to stay for cleanliness and ease of getting to and fro for the Equine Affaire. The beds are so comfortable and the pillows are especially plush or firm - you choose between the assortment given! One thing about the hotel is the Parking garage - thankfully parking was free with the Equine Affaire deal, but it is a maze of difficult cement poles to drive through and with my husbands F150 we were hard pressed to make some of the required turns. This of course shouldn't change your mind about staying here but it is an annoyance. We didn't try the breakfast as our special price of $150 didn't include breakfast but there is a restaurant that serves a breakfast buffet at the hotel.

data.title: Ugh.  Just no!!!!
data.text:
Okay, the one GOOD thing about this hotel was the location.  You're about 7 minutes with traffic to the Big E fairgrounds.  Oh and there's a Dunkin Donuts right across the bridge.   That's about it for the good.

The hotel is run down.  There were stains all over our carpet and cracked tiles in the bathroom.  The furniture is outdated and in serious need of a refresh.  The mattresses were hard and SAGGY - my back is killing me, thank you Sheraton.  The bedding is nice and fluffy but hotels should understand that there is no substitute for a good mattress!!!!  

The facility is LOUD.  Rooms are built around an open atrium and thus every noise is amplified.  It sucks.  The facility posted requests that people follow the quiet hours of 10p to 8a but people didn't and it affected my sleep (despite me using a white noise machine!).  

We had dinner in PICKS one night.  Terrible food, slow service and ridiculously overpriced.  It was $60! My daughter had a steak and I had chicken wings.  Everything was overcooked.  

I would not recommend this hotel.  I'd try the Marriott next door....

data.title: Never again
data.text:
Don't ever , ever plan to stay  here during a cheer competition.  Constant screaming, noise, kids running around everywhere, knocking on doors.  Called front desk and no other rooms available .
Worst experience at a hotel I've ever had. 
There will be no sleeping tonight !
Miserable.

data.title: Great Customer Service
data.text:
I stayed at the hotel from NOv 5-7 and the service was great.Most unusual and outstanding was a request I had to fix my television. Usually this takes forever for someone to come and look at the problem. This time the house engineer showed up in 5 minutes and was very helpful in addressing the issue.

Michael

data.title: Comfortably Average
data.text: Efficient greeting and room assignment to a clean room. TV, coffee and WiFi in room. First time finding a white noise box in case highway traffic outside became too much...didn't need it. Meeting rooms and dinner areas were spacious. Catered dinner one evening was the toughest veal I've ever tasted...inedible. Stay here, visit, meet, etc., but go out to eat.

data.title: DO NOT BOOK HERE
data.text: Do not book at this hotel.  They offer deceptive policies and will charge your cc in full right away.  If you attempt to change the reservation, or cancel, they will not refund you.  If you then ask them to reactivate the reservation since you have paid in full, they will refuse that as well.  They are not easy to work with, and will not consider any situation.  They do not care about their guests.  Stay away from the Sheraton.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Dear Angela H, Thank you for sharing your feedback on Tripadvisor and the other social media sites. I am sorry you encountered an issue during your check-in.  The cancellation policy is stated on both  our website and in the pre-stay email that is sent out. "Cancellations prior to 24hours of day of arrival maybe cancelled with out penalty".  If you had a reservation for two days and needed to depart a day early, we certainly would refund you without question.  we do not charge your card, the bank does place a hold on the account for anticipated charges and removal of this is up to the financial institution and varies from a few days up to 10 days. If you are using a debit card, than they hold your funds, if it is a credit card than it holds credit, we do have several signs on our desk reviewing this.  We will do whatever we can to assist in expediting this, but it is up to the bank in the end. I am happy to speak with you further regarding this if you wish, please do not hesitate to contact me at 413-263-2156.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wish I had stayed home instead
data.text:
We chose to stay in Springfield although we live only about 40 minutes away in CT because my daughter needed to be at the Big E early in the morning for a horse show.  The whole purpose was to be able to get some extra sleep.  While the Sheraton is very close to where we needed to be, the evening was awful.  First we found that our room abutted the highway and there are signs on the floors asking people to be quiet because the interior structure of the building causes noise to be magnified.  Then the fire alarm went off, not once, but three times during the night.

I know they need to do this for safety sake, but every time this happened, the alarm went off, there was an announcement indicating that the fire department was on the way and to stay in the rooms until we heard additional instructions.  And then some time later, just as we were drifting back to sleep, there was another announcement saying all was clear.

We were told the next morning that the reason for the first two alarms is that a guest had attempted to disable the smoke alarm in their room so that they could smoke and the reason for the third was a guest who took a steamy shower with the bathroom door open.

I did complain the next morning and they gave us 1/2 off the cost of the room, which was reasonable, but we never got any of the sleep back.  I realize much of this was not in their control, but it certainly soured the experience.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback, I too would not be happy if I was disrupted by a fire alarm. While I understand the verbal announcements can be just as disruptive, they are intended to keep our guests updated. Again, I do apologize and hope you will afford us another opportunity to show we do have a great hotel.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Smith College family weekend
data.text: Unable to get a room in Northampton, we used our Starwood points at the Sheraton at Monarch Place.. it was an easy commute of less than 30 minutes to campus. The hotel accommodations were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet and omelet station was a very welcome treat (as an SPG member). We always enjoy using the gym and pool.. Everything is clean and nicely appointed. Will definitely stay here again.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback on Tripadvisor, I am glad you found our guest rooms spacious and staff professional.  I will share your feedback regarding your wonderful breakfast experience with our culinary team.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Wonderful experience
data.text: Everyone was so friendly and truly made are weekend vacation memorable..special thanks to those at the front desk during our stay. Everyone was so accommodating and made us feel especially welcome. Angela and Austin were extremely helpful and were a key reminder of why we continue to come to this hotel. Their customer service skills were exactly what you would want and expect at a hotel such as this one.They greeted us as soon as we exited the elevator and made us feel extremely welcome and left an amazing impression on our trip. To everyone who helped our weekend vacation be one to remember thank you!!!

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing your feedback and recognizing two of our super stars.  We are lucky to have Austin and Angela working with us, they both exemplify customer service. I am glad you enjoyed your stay and we hope you will return.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Tired.
data.text: Someone needs to do a big refurb. From the 50s era salmon bathroom floor tiles to the clunky sleigh beds and tattered curtains, there is a lot of work needed. The shell of the hotel looks modern. Yet inside your room, you'll discover flimsy, dangling  phone jacks and outlet plates. Watch out in the dark of night as you navigate to the bathroom...Those sleigh bed baseboards are unforgiving to knees.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing, I am glad you stayed with us.  I am happy to share that we are in fact starting a renovation of our last 4 floors.  I can see by your room description that you stayed on one of our rooms on floors 9-12, these will be renovated starting November 16, 2016.  Please come back and visit our refreshed hotel.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Decent hotel that is conveniently located just off main highway
data.text: Our family was stopping overnight in Springfield during visits to local schools, so this was a conveniently located hotel and within the SPG family.  Although our room was not on the Club Level we were able to access the lounge due to my Lifetime Gold status.  Rooms were clean.  Beds were comfortable.  Restaurant was a bit of a disappointment.  Not many choices and quality was just OK.  Front desk staff was friendly.  Acceptable for an overnight stay.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for completing your review of our hotel.  I am happy to see you found our rooms clean and spacious and our staff friendly and professional.  I will relay your feedback to our food and beverage team.  I hope you will choose the Sheraton Springfield again, should your travels bring you back to the area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel in a good location
data.text: Great Hotel in the downtown area. Just passing through for the night but it was definitely a nice place to stay and an especially good value for a Priceline express deal. Rooms were updated and spacious. Parking was a little high.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for recognizing our property and spacious rooms.  I am glad you enjoyed yourself and hope you will return should your travels bring you back to the Springfield area.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Poor customer services on noisy guests
data.text: Spent one night here for a weekend getaway. A group of 10+ kids (look like 6-8y old) stay next door. They scream, jump all night and no adult was there to control them, wife could not go to sleep. We called guest service at 12am, not sure if anyone came to check because the noise did not change at all. We called the 2nd time at 12:37am, still no change. We called the 3rd time post 1am, finally the kids quieted down gradually. A nightmare.....Next morning when we walked out room, we see an extra bed next to the door. Before booking the room, we did check tripadvisor reviews and I remember someone had similar experience that a lot kids stayed around and jammed the club room. Seems like it's a return group of kids. That said, if you are sensitive to noise at night, find another hotel.

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for sharing and please accept my apologies for the disruption during the overnight hours.  I will review your feedback with our Front Office team and security, it should never take 3 calls to address a noise issue.  I hope you will afford us another opportunity to show we have a great property
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place for Events
data.text: We hosted an event on their outdoor pool deck, and we had a fantastic time. The food was great, service was wonderful - I even had some last minute changes (additional tables, needed a mic) and they were fantastic about making sure everything was as we wanted it. I even recall asking the events coordinator to help me with a task with just minutes before guests were due to arrived - she said yes, made a lighthearted joke - and made it happen! I appreciate that it can't always be easy to please guests and the Sheraton goes the extra mile. There was even a nice gentlemen/server who stayed late to help us clean up and get everything out the door. Thank you!

owner_response.author: Paul M, General Manager at Sheraton Springfield at Monarch Place, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for your great review of our property and the catering services we offer.  Our team is poised to take care of every detail from our outstanding culinary creations to our function space and room set-ups.  I thank you for choosing the Sheraton Springfield Monarch Place Hotel for your event.
owner_response.title: Owner Response
